template.name: alg-page
template.p: The JS-Alg module provides generic algorithms for common JavaScript patterns. This includes data validation, function preparation, array/object iteration, and many more. In many cases, these algorithms can be used to simplify code and provide variable scoping in a way more consistent with other programming languages.

The error in this code is that the value of i is captured when the function is executed, rather than when the function was created. As a result, clicking the button will open 10 alert windows, each reading "10"! Furthermore, i will also be available to the rest of the function despite being allocated inside of the first for-loop; and could potentially create hidden bugs which are difficult to find and correct.
JS-Alg provides the js.alg.iterate function to locally scope i and avoid polluting the scope with unnecessary variables:

In the above code, the i variables are only available within the context of teh loop. Further, when clicked, the button would create popups for each number, 0 through 9. Using roughly the same amount of code, JSpyder's Algorithm library can ensure that your code behaves as you expect it to.

template.p: Manipulating dates in JavaScript is not always a simple task; especially when mixing Dates and Strings or performing arithmatic. JSpyder streamlines these operations with a smoothed, object-oriented interface.
